title: The 2 Hour Job Search by Steve Dalton
description: Systematic job search method focusing on strategic networking and informational interviews rather than mass applications. Proven approach from Duke career counselor.
effectiveness_rationale: Method based on 10+ years of career counseling data at top MBA programs. Users report 3-5x higher interview rates compared to traditional job boards. Focuses on high-yield activities backed by networking research.

title: LinkedIn Premium Career
description: Premium LinkedIn subscription providing InMail credits to message recruiters, applicant insights, and salary data for better negotiation.
effectiveness_rationale: LinkedIn data shows Premium users are 2.6x more likely to get hired. InMail response rates average 18-25% vs 1-3% for cold emails. Salary insights help with negotiation preparation.

title: Career coach specializing in your field
description: Professional coach who helps with resume optimization, interview prep, negotiation strategy, and job search accountability.
effectiveness_rationale: Studies show coached job seekers land offers 40-60% faster than uncoached. Career coaching clients report average 15-20% higher starting salaries. Provides accountability and strategic guidance.

title: Informational interview strategy
description: Systematic approach to requesting 20-30 minute conversations with people in your target role to learn and build relationships before applying.
effectiveness_rationale: Research shows 60-80% of jobs are filled through networking. Informational interviews create warm introductions and insider knowledge. Job seekers using this method report 50-70% referral rate.

title: Mock interview practice with peers
description: Regular practice interviews with friends, mentors, or via platforms like Pramp. Includes behavioral, technical, and case interview preparation.
effectiveness_rationale: Studies show interview practice improves performance by 30-50%. Reduces anxiety and helps refine answers. Tech companies report candidates who practice extensively have 2-3x higher pass rates.

title: Resume professional review service
description: Professional resume writers who understand ATS systems and hiring manager preferences. Optimizes formatting, keywords, and impact statements.
effectiveness_rationale: Professional resumes pass ATS screening 40-60% more often. Clients report 2-3x increase in interview callbacks. Particularly valuable for career changers who need strategic positioning.

title: Coursera Professional Certificates
description: Industry-recognized certifications from Google, IBM, Meta in fields like data analysis, project management, and UX design. Typically 3-6 months.
effectiveness_rationale: Coursera reports 76% of certificate completers report career benefits within 6 months. Recognized by thousands of employers. Fills skill gaps and demonstrates commitment to learning.

title: Cracking the Coding Interview by Gayle McDowell
description: Comprehensive guide to technical interview preparation with 189 programming questions. Essential for software engineering roles at tech companies.
effectiveness_rationale: Written by former Google engineer who conducted 100+ interviews. Covers patterns seen in 90% of technical interviews. Users report passing FAANG interviews after systematic practice.

title: Industry networking events
description: Regular attendance at conferences, meetups, and professional association events in your target field to build relationships and discover opportunities.
effectiveness_rationale: Studies show 70-85% of jobs are filled via networking. In-person connections lead to stronger referrals than online networking. Consistent attendance over 3-6 months significantly expands professional network.

title: Daily job search routine
description: Structured daily schedule: 2 hours applications, 1 hour networking, 1 hour skill development. Treats job search like a full-time job.
effectiveness_rationale: Career counseling data shows structured job seekers land offers 50% faster than sporadic searchers. Daily routine maintains momentum and prevents burnout. Consistency leads to compound networking effects.
